DataElement.preferredName: Kidney Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Distant Metastasis M Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for the kidney carcinoma based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma arising from the epithelium of the renal parenchyma or the renal pelvis.  The majority are renal cell carcinomas.  Kidney carcinomas usually affect middle aged and elderly adults.  Hematuria, abdominal pain, and a palpable mass are common symptoms._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation. The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma arising from the epithelium of the renal parenchyma (renal cell carcinoma) or the renal pelvis (renal pelvis carcinoma).  The vast majority of renal cell carcinomas are adenocarcinomas.  The vast majority of renal pelvis carcinomas are transit

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma arising from the epithelium of the renal parenchyma or the renal pelvis.  The majority are renal cell carcinomas.  Kidney carcinomas usually affect middle aged and elderly adults.  Hematuria, abdominal pain, and a palpable mass are common symptoms.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC:American Joint Committee on Cancer Cancer Staging Manual, 7th Ed., 2009
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for BBRB per request by G.Deen. mc 4/20/16

ValueDomain.preferredName: Kidney Cancer Clinical Distant Metastasis TNM Finding v7 American Joint Committee on Cancer Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of kidney cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Kidney Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Kidney Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Kidney Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Kidney Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)
